page.title: 09School vandalism, SE Derby
page.content: Many schools in the county are facing the problem of a marked increase in vandalism. Hardly a week goes by without some new damage or graffiti coming to light. The police have an increasing burden of school burglaries to deal with. At some schools the fabric of the buildings is in a sad state with broken windows boarded up with plywood, doors smashed and graffiti on many walls. Inside the buildings the conditions are little different, with damaged fittings, leaking roofs and plaster falling off the walls. These poor working conditions reflect perhaps the boredom of modern youth and the lack of public funds to keep the buildings repaired and in good decorative order.
